content.description:
One of the harder routes on the boulders.

The giant flake out right is not used.

Start with both hands in an undercling created by the crack system. Make a hard move up to a crimp in the higher seam and adjust your feet. From here pull up and grab a better hold and make a long move to the slopey lip.

From here match hands and throw up a heel hook and press your way onto the slab while slapping and looking for anything usable. Good temps may make this a tad easier...
content.protection: Pads and a spotter. Getting ejected off the lip is not uncommon.
content.location: The rightmost climb on the face with multiple seams and cracks.

content.description: Very similar climbing to it's neighbor good ole Charlie Brown. Climb the crack features up and pull onto the slab while feeling around for small crimps and seams.
content.location: To the right of Charlie Brown. Smack in the middle of the cracked face.

content.description:
The slopey and crimppy test piece of the boulder. Easier the taller you are. Sit start at small round edges and make a big move up to gain small crimps and edges. A high foot could prove useful depending on height. Top out on small holds on a slightly grainy slab.

There is also an unnamed v2 which starts To the right of this problem and traverses up and left into the top of this line.
content.location: On the opposite side of Pig Pen and Charlie Brown. This is one of the hardest ways up the boulder.  To the right and left are some lower grade climbs.
